error.signature: Property 'X' does not exist on type 'A | B'. Property 'X' does not exist on type 'B'.

verdict.summary: TypeScript cannot narrow a union type because it lacks a discriminant property. Add a common literal type field.

dead_ends.action: Use type assertions (as TypeA) to access the property
dead_ends.why_fails: If the runtime value is actually TypeB, accessing TypeA properties causes undefined behavior

workarounds.action: Add a discriminant property with literal types to the union members
Use 'in' operator for narrowing when no discriminant exists

leads_to.condition: When exhaustive switch on discriminated union leaves never type

preceded_by.condition: When property access on union type fails

frequently_confused_with.distinction: TS2339 is general property-not-exist; discriminated union error specifically involves union types that need narrowing
